intro: Gouania microcarpa var. rugulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough, textured surface, which gives it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in the summer months. The plant is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
